B C D G M O P R S U 

B

ball - Variable in class GamePanel
the ball object
BALL_STARTING_DELTAX - Static variable in class GamePanel
the starting x speed of the ball
BALL_STARTING_DELTAY - Static variable in class GamePanel
the starting y speed of the ball
BALL_STARTING_POSX - Static variable in class GamePanel
the starting x position of the ball
BALL_STARTING_POSY - Static variable in class GamePanel
the starting y position of the ball
ballCollidesBorders() - Method in class GamePanel
checks if the ball collides with one of the upper or lower borders if it does the reflect the y speed of the ball
ballCollidesPaddles() - Method in class GamePanel
checks if the ball collides with one of the paddles if it does then reflect the x speed of the ball
ballScored() - Method in class GamePanel
checks if the ball collides with one of the left or right borders if it does then the score of the paddle that is opposite of the border gains a point and the ball is served in the direction of the paddle that got scored on

C

checkIfWon() - Method in class GamePanel
checks if the points required to win the game has been reached by one of the players if it has then the game over method is called
checkPaddleCollisionBorders(Paddle) - Method in class GamePanel
checks if the paddle has reached the edge of the game screen if it has then the paddle is not able to move in that direction anymore

D

DASH_ARRAY_LENGTH - Static variable in class GamePanel
the length of the array representing the dashing pattern
DASH_LINE_WIDTH - Static variable in class GamePanel
the width of the line down the middle
drawDashedLine(Graphics, int, int, int, int) - Method in class GamePanel
draws a dashed line based on the parameters

G

gameOver(Paddle) - Method in class GamePanel
removes the key listener from the panel to stop anymore movement creates the winner label with the name of the paddle outputs the results to the game logs
GamePanel - Class in <Unnamed>
an object that extends the JPanel object it holds the main game play of the game
GamePanel() - Constructor for class GamePanel
the constructor for game panel sets the background color based on the settings initializes all the paddles and ball also initializes the key listener

M

moveBall() - Method in class GamePanel
moves the ball based on its speed also checks if the ball reaches the left or right end
movePaddles(ArrayList<Integer>) - Method in class GamePanel
moves the paddles based on the keys within the array parameter also starts the round if the round has been ended

O

OUTPUT_FILE_NAME - Static variable in class GamePanel
the name of the file that outputs the game logs
outputToGameLog(Paddle) - Method in class GamePanel
outputs the winner of the game to the game log text file with the current date

P

paddle1 - Variable in class GamePanel
the paddle object for player1
PADDLE1_STARTING_POSX - Static variable in class GamePanel
the starting x position of paddle1
PADDLE1_STARTING_POSY - Static variable in class GamePanel
the starting y position of paddle1
paddle2 - Variable in class GamePanel
the paddle object for player2
PADDLE2_STARTING_POSX - Static variable in class GamePanel
the starting x position of paddle2
PADDLE2_STARTING_POSY - Static variable in class GamePanel
the starting y position of paddle2
paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class GamePanel
draws all the objects including the paddles, the ball, and the dashed line

R

resetRound() - Method in class GamePanel
resets the paddles and ball to their starting positions disables the keyListener until a key is released and pressed again sets the round started variable to false
run() - Method in class GamePanel
renders the game based on the REFRESH_TIME runs in a constant loop until the game is exited

S

startRound() - Method in class GamePanel
starts the round by setting the round started variable to true and serving the ball

U

update() - Method in class GamePanel
updates the positions of the paddle and the ball
